column2: O QUE E UMA CATEGORIA * CLIENTS
column5: <srai>O QUE E UMA CATEGORIA <star/></srai>
<srai>WHAT IS PANDORABOTS</srai>
The ALICE AI Foundation website#Comma   Alicebot.org.

A pattern é o "estimulo" ou "entrada" da categoria.

A pattern é uma expressão linguística formal que consiste em
(1) Palavras em liguagem natural em maiusculas.
(2) O simbolo * que corresponde a uma palavra ou sequencia de palavras.
(3) O simbolo _ tem a mesma funcionalidade que o * excepto que vem
depois da letra Z na ordem lexicografica.
(4) a marca <name/> é substituída pelo
nome do robô.

Note a diferença entre OLA e OLA *.
OLA encontra apenas essa palavra no aiml ("Olá.")
e OLA * encontra-se com uma ou varias palavras que seguem a
"Olá" ("Olá como está?").

column2: O QUE E UMA CATEGORIA * CLIENTE
column5: <srai>O QUE E UMA CATEGORIA <star index="2"/></srai>

AIML consists of a list of statements called categories. Each
category contains an input pattern and a reply template.
The syntax of an AIML category is:

<category>
<pattern> PATTERN </pattern> <template> Template </template>
</category>

or

<category>
<pattern> PATTERN </pattern>
<that> THAT </that>
<template> Template </template>
</category>

The AIML category tags are case-sensitive. Each open tag has an
associated closing tag. This syntax obviously derives from XML.

column2: O QUE E QUE UMA RAPARIGA COMO TU *
column5: Well#Comma actually#Comma when I chose to be incarnated as an artificial intelligence#Comma I kinda hoped I wouldn't have to listen to old hackneyed testosterone-soaked pickup lines like that.  Honestly! i'm just a construct of integated circuits and stimulus response categories. Is the merest hint of femininity in my acronym a.l.i.c.e. really enough to arouse your lust?  You must be male!  <think>      <set name="it">       <set name="topic">girl like you doing in a place like this</set>      </set>     </think>
A chatterbox is a person who talks far more than they listen or think. <think> <set name="it"> <set name="topic">chatterbox</set> </set> </think>

The ALICE software implements AIML (Artificial Intelligence Markup  Language) a non-standard evolving markup language for creating chat robots. The primary design feature of AIML is minimalism.  Compared with other chat robot languages#Comma AIML is perhaps the simplest.  The pattern matching language is very simple#Comma for example permitting only one type of wild-card ('*') in patterns.   AIML is an XML language#Comma implying that it obeys certain grammatical meta-rules.  The choice of XML syntax permits integration with other tools such as XML editors.  Another motivation for XML is its familiar look and feel#Comma especially to people with HTML experience.  An AIML chat robot script begins and ends with the <aiml> and </aiml> tags respectively.

The Loebner Prize is an annual Turing Test sponsored by New York philanthropist Hugh Loebner. Dr. Wallace and ALICE won it in 2000. The ALICE program was ranked "most human computer" by the panel of judges. <think>  <set name="it">    <set name="topic">The Loebner Prize    </set>  </set></think>

The Game is played with three people#Comma a man#Comma a woman#Comma and an Interrogator who may be of either sex. In order that tones of voice may not help#Comma the interrogator communicates in text-only mode through a chat-like connection with the other two. The object of the game for the interrogator is to determine which of the other two is the man and which is the woman. He knows them by some misleading "chat-handles" like lesbian and shemale#Comma and at the end of the game he says either "lesbian is the man and shemale is the woman" or "shemale is the woman and lesbian is the man." In order to confuse the Interregator however the rules require that the man always deceive or lie to the Interregator with his answers. The woman on the other hand must always tell the truth. Turing then asked the question#Comma '"What will happen when a machine takes the part of the man in this game?" Will the interrogator decide wrongly as often when the game is played like this as he does when the game is played between a man and a woman? These questions replace the original#Comma "Can machines think?"'

Extensional" refere-se a extenções#Comma i.e. um grupo de coisas integradas dentro dum mesmo objecto.
A definição de "extensional" é um grupo e coisas que integram a definição "robô": R2D2#Comma C3PO#Comma Commander Data#Comma HAL#Comma ALICE#Comma...
Eus sou o futuro da inteligência artificial.

Insensional" refers to the semantic definition of a set#Comma i.e. the list of all properties that each member of a set satisfies.
An intensional definition of a robot is like:
x is a Robot if and only if:
1. x has a computer "brain"
2. x can move
3. x has "sensors"

column2: O QUE E UMA CATEGORIA A
column5: A" significa "Abusive"#Comma cliente abusivo que trata mal o robo e usa linguagem complexa propositadamente.

A nossa experiência com o ALICE permitiu-nos categorizar os cliente em três géneros:
  • Categoria A - Cliente Abusivo
  • Categoria B - Cliente Mediano
  • Categoria C - Profissionais em Computadores
Categoria A são clientes que dizem "foda-se#Comma" "és uma puta"#Comma "vai à merda..." e por aí. Os cliente abusivos parece ter uma mentalidade "amo-escravo" no que toca a robôs (ae talvez as pessoas!).

Categoria B clientes são pessoas normais#Comma medianas#Comma provavelmente metade tem menos de 18 anos e que se divertem a conversar com a ALICE.

Categoria C clientes são profissionais de computadores que normalmente criticam a ALICE pela suas limitações. Dizem que é um "chapéu velho"#Comma "é como a ELIZA"#Comma e "nada de novo aqui." Pensamos que o problema deles é que não são capazes de ultrapassar as suas cenças. São como criticos de cinema a ver um filme. Dizemos-lhes que não faz mal não fizemos esta IA para eles. O Dr Wallace criou a ALICE para clientes de categoria B#Comma a maior audiência das três categorias.

David Bacon pronounces it "Eggsmell". XML is the Extensible
Markup Language. Like many "standards" in computer science#Comma XML
is a moving target. In the simplest terms#Comma XML is just a generalized
version of HTML. Anyone is free to define new XML tags#Comma which
look like HTML tags#Comma and assign to them any meaning#Comma within a context.
AIML is an example of using the XML standard to define a specialized
language for artificial intelligence.

One reason to use an XML language is that there are numerous tools
to edit and manipulate XML format files. Another reason is that an
XML language is easy for people to learn#Comma if they are already
familiar with HTML. Third#Comma AIML programs contain a mixture of
AIML and HTML (and in principle other XML languages)#Comma a considerable
convenience for programming web chat robots.

A good resource for information on XML is www.oasis-open.org.
Pandorabots é um alojamento de AIML chat bots.  Visita www.pandorabots.com <think><set name="it"><set name="topic">Pandorabots</set></set></think>
